stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.

stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.

preGame:
üéôÔ∏è Hello everybody! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the nose-bleed heights of Oread's Summit! We are perched atop The High-Pass Pitch, where the air is so thin you‚Äôd think the Guild of the Black Sky was charging for every breath! We're in the thick of the Winners Bracket, and let me tell you, the playoff atmosphere is electric‚Äîor maybe that‚Äôs just the static from the impending blizzards! The Confluence Captains lead this Best of 3 series 1-0, and they‚Äôre looking to close the deal and send the Tamers down to the Losers Bracket where the Haven Lights probably belong! üèîÔ∏è

I just saw Ladew Evelina chugging her customary raw egg‚Äîshell and all‚Äîand she looked like she was ready to headbutt a mountain! On the other side, the Tamers are looking desperate. Saloma Talich is having his teammates punch him in the shoulder with enough force to crack a rib, and Swamy Ahasuerus is dunking her hands in ice water. I suppose if the weather doesn't freeze your fingers off, the well water will! It‚Äôs a beautiful day for a tragedy, folks! ü•ö

Speaking of tragedies, I think I see a few of the realm's 'heroes' in the VIP box. Is that Nikos Thanae looking 'benevolent' while clutching his coin purse? Or perhaps Sir Garon Ironrock is just here to admire the stonework of the pass! Regardless of the company, the Captains are trying to stay focused. I saw O'Conner Maighdlin speaking only in rhymes earlier; I hope his poetry is as sharp as his hatchet, because he's going to need it to survive the altitude! üß§

The crowd today is... well, it's sparse compared to those Zmeigorod Snessenger fanatics, but the ones who made the climb are screaming loud enough to trigger an avalanche! The Captains have the momentum, but the Tamers have the home-field advantage of vertigo and sudden blizzards. Will the Captains sweep the series, or will the Tamers claw their way back? Grab your gear and hold onto your souls, because Tuesday Night Trollball is on the air! üì¢
postGame:
üèÜ Holy Mackerel, what a display of high-altitude homicide! The Oread's Summit Tamers have pulled off a miraculous 9-6 victory, evening this series at 1-1! We are going to a Game 3, sports fans! The Confluence Captains came in looking for a sweep, but they ran into a wall of mountain muscle and thin-air desperation. It was a game of two halves and enough injuries to keep a dozen healers like Kant Langill busy until next season! üèüÔ∏è

The action started with a bang as Dric Trilley decided she didn't like the look of the goal and put the ball through it from Center Field for a 2-point shoot! The Captains answered back quickly with Deach Sharlene‚Äîwho apparently plays better with his boots on the wrong feet‚Äîcharging into the End Zone for a thunderous dunk! It was a back-and-forth affair that saw more leather and blood flying than a butcher's shop in a hurricane! üí•

But let‚Äôs talk about that first-half massacre! The Tamers' defense turned into a literal meat grinder. Mitran Mariand laid out O'Conner Maighdlin, and before we could even blink, Dric Trilley sent Richia Pazit to the dirt. The injuries started piling up like gold in a money priest‚Äôs vault! Caves Cestar, Ladew Evelina, Belding Chloe, and Carnahan Laud all went down hard. It‚Äôs a wonder anyone was left to hold the ball! Clippard Burr even decided to tackle Stephan Lisk just for the fun of it before the halftime whistle! ü§ï

After the break, the Captains tried to regain their footing, but the High-Pass Pitch had other ideas. We saw interceptions flying left and right! Deach Sharlene snagged a wild pass from Kass Fogel, only for Behl Berstine to get laid out immediately after. The violence reached such a fever pitch that the game had to be momentarily halted because one team simply ran out of vertical players! That is the kind of commitment to the sport I love to see‚Äîplaying until you physically cannot stand! üöë

Richia Pazit managed to claw a dunk back for the Captains, but the Tamers were relentless. O'Conner Maighdlin tried to keep the away team in it with a stunning long-distance shoot, but the Tamers' synergy was just too much. Swamy Ahasuerus, despite dropping a few passes earlier, delivered a beautiful ball to Dric Trilley in the End Zone for a massive score that sent the mountain fans into a frenzy! üèîÔ∏è

I have to mention the interference of the elements. Between the Glowstone Glare from the visitors' gear and the dizzying heights, it‚Äôs a miracle anyone could see the goal! Even the legendary Alwyn Wandy got into the scoring act with a 2-point shoot from the Away Field! It was as if the very mountains were pushing the ball into the basket for the home team. The 'heroes' in the stands must have been clutching their pearls at the sheer brutality of it all! üå¨Ô∏è

Richia Pazit tried to mount a late-game comeback with another 2-point shoot from the Home 2-Point zone, but it was like throwing a bucket of water on a forest fire. The Tamers were simply too hungry for that series tie. The Captains looked winded, and who can blame them? Chugging raw eggs is great for the spirit, but it doesn't do much for your lungs when the air is this thin! üç≥

By the final whistle, the field looked like a battlefield from the Everwar, but with more sportsmanship and slightly less permanence. The Tamers stand tall at 9 points, leaving the Captains at 6. My favorite Ebon Gate Corruptors would have appreciated the way Saloma Talich and Zadoc Wyatan dismantled the Captains' offensive line toward the end. It was a masterclass in physical persuasion! üòà

So, we head back to the drawing board for Game 3! The Captains have the popularity and the talent, but the Tamers have the mountain's favor and a renewed sense of bloodlust. Will the Guild‚Äôs favorites crumble under the pressure, or will they find their rhythm again? One thing is for sure: the loser of the next game is heading straight to the Losers Bracket, and I‚Äôll be there to laugh at their misfortune! üìâ

Final score: Oread's Summit Tamers 9, Confluence Captains 6! This series is TIED! I'm Nok the Corrupter, and if you'll excuse me, I need to go see if Imra has any 'dust' left to help me deal with this altitude sickness. Stay brutal, stay bloody, and we'll see you for the tie-breaker! Goodnight, Osterra! üéôÔ∏è‚ú®
